incidents.title: Compute1 Cloud Maintenance
incidents.content:
To further improve and optimize our product quality, we are performing a free network upgrade on our host systems. We upgrade from the current 20 Gbit connection to now 80 Gbit per compute node!

The maintenance work will take place on Monday, 19th of September 2022 at 20:00 (CEST) and will end at approximately 20:30 (CEST), although we will try to keep the interruption as minimal as possible.

During this time, cloud servers may be temporarily unavailable and will be shutdown via APCI (Software Shutdown).

Thank you for your understanding.

2022-09-19T18:00:00.000Z
Update

We are beginning with the maintenance now. Instances might be unavailable during this time.

2022-09-19T18:36:00.000Z
Update

Instances are currently booting and we are monitoring the process.

2022-09-19T18:48:00.000Z
Completed

All instances are back online. Maintenance is now complete.

incidents.title: Compute1 Cloud Maintenance
incidents.content:
In order to further improve our product quality and guarantee the stability of our services, we will perform maintenance on our cloud servers.

The maintenance work will take place on Monday, 08th of August 2022 at 10:00 (CEST) and will end at approximately 10:30 (CEST), although we will try to keep the interruption as minimal as possible.

During this time, cloud servers may be temporarily unavailable and will be shutdown via APCI (Software Shutdown).

Thank you for your understanding.

2022-08-08T08:00:00.000Z
Update

We are beginning with the maintenance now. Instances might be unavailable during this time.

2022-08-08T08:40:00.000Z
Update

We are currently having issues with the control plane and are unable to start the VMs. The issue is currently being investigated, however we are unable to give an exact timeframe when the services will recover. This page will be updated as soon as we have more information.

2022-08-08T12:05:00.000Z
Restoring Services

Some Control plane services have been restored to allow VMs to be started. Instances should now be reachable and start/stop via the web panel should be possible. We are still working on restoring other services, such as volume/image management. This page will be updated as soon as more information becomes available.

2022-08-08T13:00:00.000Z
Resolved

All services have been restored. We apologize for the prolonged downtime. Due to an issue during a control plane upgrade, we were unable to start the instances after the completed maintenance on compute hosts. Due to several incompatibilities we were required to upgrade other services as well.

incidents.title: Compute1 Cloud Maintenance
incidents.content:
In order to further improve our product quality and guarantee the stability of our services, we will perform maintenance on our cloud servers.

The maintenance work will take place on Friday, 15th of July 2022 at 10:00 (CEST) and will end at approximately 10:30 (CEST), although we will try to keep the interruption as minimal as possible.

During this time, cloud servers may be temporarily unavailable and will be shutdown via APCI (Software Shutdown).

Thank you for your understanding.

2022-07-15T08:00:00.000Z
Update

We are beginning with the maintenance now. Instances might be unavailable during this time.

2022-07-15T08:35:00.000Z
Update

Instances are currently booting and we are monitoring the process.

2022-07-15T08:45:00.000Z
Completed

All instances are back online. Maintenance is now complete.
